alert.note: Alert for Middlesex; Norfolk; Worcester (Massachusetts) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flash Flood Warning issued July 21 at 10:55PM EDT until July 22 at 12:15AM EDT by NWS Boston
info.description: ...FLASH FLOOD WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 1215 AM EDT SATURDAY FOR SOUTHEASTERN WORCESTER, NORTHWESTERN NORFOLK AND SOUTHEASTERN MIDDLESEX COUNTIES... At 1055 PM EDT, The last batch of downpours was exiting central and interior eastern Massachusetts. This will begin to allow flood waters to recede late tonight. HAZARD...Flash flooding caused by thunderstorms. SOURCE...Radar. IMPACT...Flash flooding of streams, urban areas, highways, streets and underpasses as well as other poor drainage and low-lying areas. Some locations that will experience flash flooding include... Worcester, Newton, Framingham, Waltham, Brookline, Arlington, Billerica, Marlborough, Woburn, Shrewsbury, Natick, Watertown, Lexington, Needham, Milford, Wellesley, Dedham, Belmont and Burlington. FLASH FLOOD...RADAR INDICATED EXPECTED RAINFALL RATE...1-1.5 INCHES IN 1 HOUR
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Be especially cautious at night when it is harder to recognize the dangers of flooding. Be aware of your surroundings and do not drive on flooded roads.
